title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #927: Distinct Clique Sizes**

g(n) = max distinct clique sizes in any graph on n vertices.

**Conjecture:** g(n) = n - log₂n - log*(n) + O(1)

**ANSWER: NO** - Spencer (1971) disproved it.

**Correct:** g(n) = n - log₂n - Θ(1) (no log* needed)

title: Cliques
content:
**Clique Definitions:**

A clique is a complete subgraph.

```lean
def IsClique {V : Type*} (G : SimpleGraph V) (S : Set V) : Prop :=
  ∀ u ∈ S, ∀ v ∈ S, u ≠ v → G.Adj u v
```

HasCliqueOfSize G k means G contains a clique of exactly k vertices.

title: g(n)
content:
**The Function g(n):**

Maximum number of different clique sizes achievable in any graph on n vertices.

```lean
noncomputable def g (n : ℕ) : ℕ := ...
```

Trivially g(n) ≤ n since clique sizes are in {1, ..., n}.

title: Moon-Moser Bounds
content:
**Moon-Moser (1965):**

First bounds on g(n):

n - log₂n - 2log log n < g(n) ≤ n - ⌊log₂n⌋

The upper bound is tight up to lower-order terms.

title: log*(n)
content:
**Iterated Logarithm:**

log*(n) = number of times log₂ must be applied until result < 1.

log*(2) = 1, log*(4) = 2, log*(16) = 3, log*(65536) = 4

log* grows EXTREMELY slowly - log*(n) ≤ 5 for all practical n.

title: Erdős's Conjecture
content:
**Erdős (1966):**

Conjectured g(n) = n - log₂n - log*(n) + O(1).

This would mean losing log*(n) clique sizes is unavoidable.

**STATUS: FALSE**

title: Spencer's Theorem
content:
**Spencer (1971):**

g(n) > n - log₂n - C for constant C.

```lean
axiom spencer_theorem :
    ∃ C : ℝ, C > 0 ∧
      ∀ n : ℕ, n ≥ 2 →
        (g n : ℝ) > n - Real.log n / Real.log 2 - C
```

The log*(n) term is NOT needed!

title: Correct Asymptotic
content:
**The True Answer:**

g(n) = n - log₂n - Θ(1)

The gap between upper and lower bounds is just a constant - the iterated logarithm plays no role.

title: erdos_927_summary
content:
**Complete Summary:**

**History:**
1. Moon-Moser (1965): Initial bounds
2. Erdős (1966): Conjectured log* loss
3. Spencer (1971): DISPROVED - no log* needed

**Conjecture:** g(n) = n - log₂n - log*(n) + O(1)
**Answer:** FALSE

**Correct:** g(n) = n - log₂n - Θ(1)
